het_1123.human_text: OLD DAIRY FARMERS never die , they just go to the udder place .
het_1123.human_explanation: The joke is a pun.  The speaker replaced the word 'other' in the phrase 'the other place' with 'udder'.  'The other place' generally is referring to hell instead of heaven.  Female cows have udders, and 'udder' sounds like 'other'.

het_112.pun_sense: a vasodilator (trade name Loniten) used to treat severe hypertension; one side effect is hirsutism so it is also sold (trade name Rogaine) as a treatment for male-patterned baldness
het_112.alter_sense: get or find back; recover the use of
het_112.human_text: The bald man decided to consider a hair transplant to rogaine his confidence in looking younger .
het_112.human_explanation: This is a play on words. The word "Rogaine" is a brand of medication to treat baldness but also sounds like "regain" meaning to get back confidence.

het_1117.pun_sense: a hill that rises abruptly from the surrounding region; has a flat top and sloping sides
het_1117.alter_sense: the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on
het_1117.human_text: My friends call me Mesa because of my big butte .
het_1117.human_explanation: This is a play on words. A butte is an isolated hill similar to a mesa. However, "butte" also sounds like "butt" which refers to the rear end of the body.

het_1115.pun_sense: a visual display of information; a visual representation of the relations between certain quantities, represented as points, plotted with reference to a set of axes
het_1115.alter_sense: (surgery) tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient; in some cases the patient can be both donor and recipient
het_1115.human_text: A scientist who wanted a tattoo got a skin graph .
het_1115.human_explanation: A skin graft is a patch of skin that is removed by surgery from one area of the body and is attached to another area. "Skin graft" sounds like "skin graph". A tattoo is a type of skin modification involving ink. A graph is a diagram showing the relation between variable quantities, typically of two variables. Scientists often use or analyze graphs to understand trends. This pun is playing on the word "graph" because it sounds like "graft" as in "skin graft" while referring to a scientist wanting a tattoo.

het_1114.pun_sense: a single whole grain of a cereal
het_1114.alter_sense: a commissioned military officer in the United States Army or Air Force or Marines who ranks above a lieutenant colonel and below a brigadier general
het_1114.human_text: He rose through the ranks of the International Corn Growers association , eventually becoming a kernel .
het_1114.human_explanation: Colonel is a homophone of kernel. A colonel is an army officer of high rank. A kernel is a seed, often the seed of corn. The joke is talking about a man rising through the ranks in the Corn Growers association. He became a "kernel" which can be understood as the man literally turning into a seed, or can be understood as "colonel" since he rose in rank.

het_1112.pun_sense: put into words or an expression
het_1112.human_text: Tired well worn expressions need to be phrased out of the language .
het_1112.human_explanation: A phrase is a group of words which act together as a unit. Language consists of phrases. "Phrased out" sounds like "phased out". "Phased out" means to slowly get rid of, or eliminate. This joke is playing on the term "phase out" except "phrased" is used instead of "phased".

het_111.pun_sense: a coating of gold or of something that looks like gold
het_111.alter_sense: remorse caused by feeling responsible for some offense
het_111.human_text: People who like gold paint have a gilt complex .
het_111.human_explanation: Gilt sounds like the word guilt but the two words mean different things. Gilt means to cover something thinly with gold. People who like gold paint have a gilt complex. This joke is a play on "guilt complex". A guilt complex is when someone has the obsession that they have done something wrong. In this case, someone has a gold covering complex.

het_1105.alter_sense: a hairdresser who cuts hair and shaves beards as a trade
het_1105.human_text: ' ' Give me a haircut , ' ' Tom said barbarously .
het_1105.human_explanation: The joke is a play on words. To do or say something 'barbarously' is to be loud or rowdy.  'Barbarously' sounds like 'barber', and barbers cut hair.

het_1104.pun_sense: an imaginary being similar to a person but smaller and with hairy feet; invented by J.R.R. Tolkien
het_1104.alter_sense: (psychology) an automatic pattern of behavior in reaction to a specific situation; may be inherited or acquired through frequent repetition
het_1104.human_text: I keep reading ' The Lord of the Rings ' over and over . I guess it ' s just force of hobbit .
het_1104.human_explanation: "Force of habit" means something that has the tendency for something to be done frequently. Lord of the Rings is a series of fantasy novels written by J.R.R. Tolkien. "The Hobbit" is a fantasy novel that proceeded the Lord of the Rings series which was also written by J.R.R. Tolkien. The joke is centered around the word "hobbit" since it sounds like "habit" and its use in the common phrase "force of habit", turned into "force of hobbit".

het_1103.human_text: When asked by her co - workers whether they should bring a gift to her birthday party , Mary replied , ' ' You should know that all I ' m interested in is your presence . ' '
het_1103.human_explanation: This is an amusing joke that seems to imply opposite meanings - making it a double entendre. If Mary only cares about their presence, it means she just wants her guests to show up, but the word itself sounds a lot like presents, implying the exact opposite of what was written.

het_1101.pun_sense: a government ship that is available for waging war
het_1101.human_text: A chaplain on the sea leads the soldiers in their warship .
het_1101.human_explanation: This is a pun on "warship". The soldiers on the sea are in a warship. Warship sounds like worship. There is a chaplain with them, a member of the clergy who ministers to a group outside of church. The chaplain leads them to worship God.

het_11.pun_sense: in an arch manner; with playful slyness or roguishness
het_11.alter_sense: a curved bony structure supporting or enclosing organs (especially the inner sides of the feet)
het_11.human_text: It ' s between my sole and my heel , said Tom archly .
het_11.human_explanation: To express something archly, is to express something in a teasing sort of way. The arch of a foot is the curved part of the foot that is between the toes and heel. The word archly was selectly chosen here because the word "arch" can be found in that word.

het_1095.alter_sense: a sudden and decisive change of government illegally or by force
het_1095.human_text: We ' ve taken over the government , Tom cooed
het_1095.human_explanation: The joke is a pun.  Taking over the government is called a 'coup' which sounds like 'coo'.  A 'coo' is a noise like a murmurring of a bird.

het_1094.pun_sense: a complaint uttered in a plaintive whining way
het_1094.human_text: The steward refused to swallow the harsh whine of the petulant cabernet peddler .
het_1094.human_explanation: "To swallow the harsh whine" means to put up with complaining. Whine sounds like wine. Cabernet is a type of wine. Wine is an alcoholic drink, whereas whine is a sound made to express a complaint.

het_1090.pun_sense: the small group of Quechua living in the Cuzco Valley in Peru who established hegemony over their neighbors in order to create an empire that lasted from about 1100 until the Spanish conquest in the early 1530s; a member of the Quechuan people living in the Cuzco valley in Peru
het_1090.alter_sense: a liquid used for printing or writing or drawing
het_1090.human_text: What do you call Peruvian Rorschach tests ? Inca Blots .
het_1090.human_explanation: "Inca blots" sounds like "inkblots". The Rorschach test is a psychological test in which subjects' perceptions of inkblots are recorded and then analyzed. The Inca civilization existed in ancient Peru beginning around 1400 CE. This joke is playing on the word "Inca" because it sounds like "ink" and it references people that once lived in Peru.

het_1089.alter_sense: (French) a street or road in France
het_1089.human_text: ' I got lost in the streets of Paris , ' he said ruefully .
het_1089.human_explanation: rue means street or road in french but you have to have know that to find it funny

het_1086.pun_sense: (physiology) a shortening or tensing of a part or organ (especially of a muscle or muscle fiber)
het_1086.alter_sense: something done (usually as opposed to something said)
het_1086.human_text: She said she wasn ' t pregnant but contractions speak louder then words .
het_1086.human_explanation: "Actions speak louder than words" is a common saying that means your actions tell the truth even if what you say does not. She said she wasn't preganant, yet her "contractions speak louder than words". Contractions are when the uterine muscles become shorter. Contractions happen before the birth of the baby happens. We see the word "action" in "contractions". "Contractions speak louder than words" is supposed to share similarity with "actions speak louder than words".

het_1085.pun_sense: founder of modern communism; wrote the Communist Manifesto with Engels in 1848; wrote Das Kapital in 1867 (1818-1883)
het_1085.alter_sense: a number or letter indicating quality (especially of a student's performance)
het_1085.human_text: I dropped out of my communism class because of lousy Marx .
het_1085.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'Marx', which is referencing Karl Marx who wrote the book Communist Manifesto, but it's also being used since 'Marx' sounds similar to 'marks' which is a type of grade you receive in a class

het_1084.alter_sense: sheet glass cut in shapes for windows or doors
het_1084.human_text: She was only a Glazier ' s daughter , but she was never a pain to me .
het_1084.human_explanation: The joke is a pun. A glazier is a person whose profession is fitting glass into windows and doors.  Windows have an outer edge called a window pane.  'Pane' sounds the same as the word 'pain' meaning the feeling of hurt, or could be used to describe someone as annoying.

het_1082.pun_sense: a dull persistent (usually moderately intense) pain
het_1082.alter_sense: animal reproductive body consisting of an ovum or embryo together with nutritive and protective envelopes; especially the thin-shelled reproductive body laid by e.g. female birds
het_1082.human_text: OLD CHICKEN FARMERS never die , they just end up with a dozen aches .
het_1082.human_explanation: I think the joke is a pun. 'Aches' sounds similar to 'eggs'.  Chickens lay eggs, and instead of dying, maybe old chicken farmers just have a lot of aches, or pains.
human_keywords: end up with a dozen aches

het_1080.pun_sense: socialist who wrote the Communist Manifesto with Karl Marx in 1848 (1820-1895)
het_1080.alter_sense: a biased way of looking at or presenting something
het_1080.human_text: Communism is a complicated thing . You must think about from all sorts of Engels .
het_1080.human_explanation: This is a pun on the phrase 'think about it from all sorts of angles' which means to try look at something from different perspectives, but 'Engel' is used instead of 'angle' because it sounds similar and because Friedrich Engels was a philospher who co-authored The Communist Manifesto

het_108.pun_sense: with ease (`easy' is sometimes used informally for `easily')
het_108.alter_sense: an upright tripod for displaying something (usually an artist's canvas)
het_108.human_text: ' ' Now I can do some painting , ' ' said Tom easily .
het_108.human_explanation: The joke is a pun.  'Easily' means 'without difficulty', but the word sounds like 'easel' which is a stand for holding a canvas or paper for making art while it is being worked on.

het_1079.pun_sense: the narrowing of the body between the ribs and hips
het_1079.alter_sense: any materials unused and rejected as worthless or unwanted
het_1079.human_text: The dieters vowed to let nothing go to waist .
het_1079.human_explanation: The joke is a play on words. Dieters are usually watching their figures and want to prevent fatty foods or carbs from adding weight to parts of their bodies, such as the waist area.  Letting something 'go to waste' means to not use all of something and have to throw away some left overs.  The phrase sounds more like the dieters don't want any fatty foods to add weight to their waists.

het_1078.pun_sense: supplying dry land with water by means of ditches etc
het_1078.alter_sense: the act of troubling or annoying someone
het_1078.human_text: My neighbor ' s sprinkler is a constant irrigation to me .
het_1078.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'irritation' which is the state of feeling annoyed, impatient, or slightly angry, but 'irrigation' is used in it's place because it sounds similar and it means the supply of water to land or crops to help growth, typically by means of channels, like what sprinkers do

het_1076.pun_sense: a black colloidal substance consisting wholly or principally of amorphous carbon and used to make pigments and ink
het_1076.alter_sense: be agreeable or acceptable; accord or comport with; be agreeable or acceptable to
het_1076.human_text: Santa goes down the chimney because it soots him .
het_1076.human_explanation: Soots sounds like the word "suits". It suits santa to go down the chimney, as in he prefers doing so. Soot is the powdery, black stuff left after you get a fire going in the fireplace.

het_1071.pun_sense: a periodic count of the population
het_1071.alter_sense: a general conscious awareness; sound practical judgment
het_1071.human_text: Old genealogists never die , they just lose their census .
het_1071.human_explanation: A genealogist is a person who traces or studies the descent of people. A census is an official count of a population, typically recording details of individuals.Census sounds like senses. Senses encompass different organs that help a person understand the world around them by allowing the person to experience sight, smell, hearing, taste, and touch. When people age, their senses dull. This joke is playing on the word census which sounds like senses.

het_1070.alter_sense: following the third position; number four in a countable series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position or time or degree or magnitude; in the fourth place
het_1070.human_text: ' ' I won ' t finish in fifth place , ' ' Tom held forth .
het_1070.human_explanation: The joke is a pun. To 'hold forth' is to talk lengthily, assertively, or tediously about a subject.  The speaker is likely in fourth place in a race, based on the context, and they sound like they want to hold their position in fourth place, or 'hold fourth'.

het_107.pun_sense: a feeling of delighted approval and liking; an attitude of admiration or esteem
het_107.alter_sense: water at boiling temperature diffused in the atmosphere
het_107.human_text: Giving praise is when you let off esteem .
het_107.human_explanation: This is a play on words. To "let off steam" means releasing pent up energy or emotion but "steam" sounds like "esteem" meaning respect and admiration.

het_1066.pun_sense: (of a musical instrument) intermediate between alto and baritone or bass
het_1066.alter_sense: given to sympathy or gentleness or sentimentality; having or displaying warmth or affection
het_1066.human_text: One day my friend asked me , how do you take such good care of your saxophone . I responded with tenor , love and care .
het_1066.human_explanation: "Tendor love and care" is a common phrase used to describe what one needs emotionally. The joke here replaced tendor with tenor because it sounded close, and we're talking about a saxophone. A saxophine is a musical instrument. A tenor saxophone is a saxophone type.

het_1063.pun_sense: any of various soft sweet desserts thickened usually with flour and baked or boiled or steamed
het_1063.alter_sense: formulate in a particular style or language
het_1063.human_text: This is some pretty good tapioca . That ' s one way of pudding it .
het_1063.human_explanation: This is a pun on the phrase 'that's on way of putting it', which often implies that the previous statement was unexpected or that it was not the way most people would say it. Howver, 'pudding' is used in it's place because it sounds similar and tapioca is a type of pudding

het_106.pun_sense: an inferior dog or one of mixed breed
het_106.alter_sense: a medicine or therapy that cures disease or relieve pain
het_106.human_text: Neuter your dog - an ounce of prevention is better than a pound of curs .
het_106.human_explanation: It's a pun on curs/cures. It doesn't work though because the use of the word cur, or a 'poorly bred dog', fell out of fashion a long time ago.

het_1057.pun_sense: any of various edible mushrooms of the genus Morchella having a brownish spongelike cap
het_1057.alter_sense: the significance of a story or event
het_1057.human_text: Absent the fungus , the story had no morel
het_1057.human_explanation: This is a play on words. A "moral" is the main lesson or message of a story but a "morel" is an edible fungus.

het_1055.pun_sense: the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of a circle; approximately equal to 3.14159265358979323846...
het_1055.alter_sense: dish baked in pastry-lined pan often with a pastry top
het_1055.human_text: My wife is a fine cook , plus a great algebra teacher , she is quite famous for her pi .
het_1055.human_explanation: The joke is a pun. 'Pi' has a double meaning. Pi is a number related to the radius and circumference of circles in algebra.  Pi sounds like 'pie' which would also make sense in that sentence, as the wife is both an algebra teacher and fine cook.

het_1054.pun_sense: any of several chemical elements that are usually shiny solids that conduct heat or electricity and can be formed into sheets etc.
het_1054.human_text: The undersized and timorous knight , armed only with an aluminum sword , lacked the adequate metal to face the ferocious dragon .
het_1054.human_explanation: Wordy as this joke is, it still works because 'metal' refers to both literal metal in a sword, and is a play on 'mettle', or courage needed to face the dragon. The knight lacked both.

het_1053.pun_sense: a pointed tool for marking surfaces or for punching small holes
het_1053.alter_sense: (quantifier) used with either mass or count nouns to indicate the whole number or amount of or every one of a class
het_1053.human_text: The shoemaker did not deny his apprentice anything he needed . He gave his awl .
het_1053.human_explanation: The joke is a pun. 'Gave his awl' is a parody of the phrase 'gave his all' which means to put in maximum effort into a task.  An awl is a small pointed tool used for piercing holes, especially in leather, which would be used by a leather shoe maker.

het_1052.pun_sense: a unit of power equal to 1 joule per second; the power dissipated by a current of 1 ampere flowing across a resistance of 1 ohm
het_1052.alter_sense: to a very great degree or extent
het_1052.human_text: Sign : ' Please turn out the lights . Thanks a watt . '
het_1052.human_explanation: A watt is a unit of measurement of energy transfer, and it sounds like the phrase " a lot". In this case, the phrase is meant to sound like " thanks a lot" in reference to turning the light off, and saving energy in doing so.

het_1050.pun_sense: glove that encases the thumb separately and the other four fingers together
het_1050.human_text: A cat that swallowed a ball of wool had mittens .
het_1050.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'mittens' which are gloves with two sections, one for the thumb and the other for all four fingers and are usually made of wool. It's being used because cats give birth to kittens which sounds similar to 'mittens'

het_1048.pun_sense: a structure consisting of a room or set of rooms at a single position along a vertical scale
het_1048.alter_sense: a message that tells the particulars of an act or occurrence or course of events; presented in writing or drama or cinema or as a radio or television program; a record or narrative description of past events
het_1048.human_text: An architect knows how to make a long storey short .
het_1048.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'make a long story short' which is used to indicate that you are providing just the basic facts rather than giving a lengthy explanation for something. However, 'storey' is used in place of 'story' because it sounds identically similar and because 'storey' refers to a part of a building comprising all the rooms that are on the same level, which is what architectures deal with

het_1045.pun_sense: discharge (phlegm or sputum) from the lungs and out of the mouth
het_1045.alter_sense: regard something as probable or likely
het_1045.human_text: When I first tried the new cough syrup , I really had no idea what to expectorate .
het_1045.human_explanation: This is a play on words. The word "expect" means to anticipate but also sounds like "expectorate" which means to cough or spit out, as one would do after drinking too much cough syrup.

het_1043.pun_sense: the activity of persuading someone to buy
het_1043.alter_sense: a room where a prisoner is kept
het_1043.human_text: Nearing the end of his sentence , the convicted Wall Street wizard , feeling both oddly safe in his spartan confinement but not quite penitent for his overzealous trading misdeeds , feared and anticipated his release , nightly dreaming of his long cherished hard sell .
het_1043.human_explanation: This is a play on words. A "hard sell" is the use of aggressive salesmanship or advertising, which someone on Wall Street would use when conducting business. However, "sell" sounds like "cell" which is a room where a prisoner is locked up. Here, a "hard cell" refers to the uncomfortable prison where the Wall Street wizard is forced to stay.

het_104.pun_sense: showing pensive sadness; deeply or seriously thoughtful
het_104.alter_sense: a writing implement with a point from which ink flows
het_104.human_explanation: Pensive means thoughtful. A pen is a writing tool that authors use to write down their thoughts. Authors are thoughtful and use pens. The joke is playing on the word "pensive" and the word "pen" that we see in it.

het_1035.pun_sense: termination of a business operation by using its assets to discharge its liabilities
het_1035.alter_sense: a substance that is liquid at room temperature and pressure; fluid matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume
het_1035.human_text: When bottled water is cheap it ' s called a liquidation sale .
het_1035.human_explanation: Liquid is found in "liquidation". In business, liquidation is the process of bringing a business to an end. During liquidation sales, items get sold for extremely cheap. The joke is talking about cheap bottled water. Water is a liquid at room temperature. The joke is playing on the word  liquidation.

het_1033.human_text: It was such a big piece of gold , he didn ' t know what to assay .
het_1033.human_explanation: This is a pun on the word "assay". Assay is the testing of a substance such as gold to determine its ingredients and quality. It sounds kind of like "say".

het_1032.pun_sense: expect, believe, or suppose; put forward, of a guess, in spite of possible refutation
het_1032.alter_sense: a visitor to whom hospitality is extended
het_1032.human_text: ' ' You must be my host , ' ' Tom guessed .
het_1032.human_explanation: The joke is a play on words.  'Guessed' sounds like 'guest'.  A host is the person who arranges and invites people for an event, while a guest is one who attends the event.

het_1031.pun_sense: allow or plan for a certain possibility; concede the truth or validity of something; afford possibility
het_1031.alter_sense: using the voice; not silently; with relatively high volume
het_1031.human_text: ' ' There ' s no need for silence , ' ' Tom allowed .
het_1031.human_explanation: "Allowed" sounds like "aloud". To allow something is to give permission to do something. The word "aloud" means to speak in a way that can be clearly heard. The joke is in Tom allowing sound, and "allowed" is a homophone of "aloud". The joke is playing on the word allowed.

het_1030.pun_sense: complete and without restriction or qualification; sometimes used informally as intensifiers
het_1030.alter_sense: a large edge tool that cuts sheet metal by passing a blade through it; cut or cut through with shears; cut with shears
het_1030.human_text: ' Sweeney Todd ' is a good source of sheer terror .
het_1030.human_explanation: The joke is a pun. Sweeney Todd is a horror film about a barber with blades on his fingers.  'Sheer' means 'nothing other than; unmitigated (used for emphasis).'  The word sounds identical to 'shear' which refers to a blade used for cutting hair.

het_1029.pun_sense: pertaining to or involving or having the nature of space
het_1029.alter_sense: surpassing what is common or usual or expected
het_1029.human_text: Aliens are lovable because they ' re so spatial .
het_1029.human_explanation: Spatial is an adjective, that relates to occupying space. In this case, outer space for the aliens. "Spatial" sounds close to the word "special" which means unique. This joke is playing on the word "spatial" and how it sounds close to "special".

het_1027.pun_sense: a car with two doors and front seats and a luggage compartment
het_1027.alter_sense: a farm building for housing poultry
het_1027.human_text: A chicken farmer ' s favorite car is a coupe .
het_1027.human_explanation: A coupe is a type of car. "Coupe" sounds like "coop". A coop is a cage for keeping chickens in. This joke is a play on the word "coupe" and it references "coop" and chickens.

het_1024.alter_sense: a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound
het_1024.human_text: Can you read music ? the bandleader asked notably .
het_1024.human_explanation: This is a pun on how musical pieces are made of 'notes', and how a bandleader is asking if someone can read the notes.

het_1020.pun_sense: box in which a corpse is buried or cremated
het_1020.alter_sense: exhale abruptly, as when one has a chest cold or congestion
het_1020.human_text: I had such a bad cold , I thought I was coffin to death .
het_1020.human_explanation: A coffin is a box that the deceased are put into before they are buried. "Coffin" sounds like "coughin". "Coughin" or "coughing" is a bodily action characterized by air expelling from the lungs and throat aggressively. This joke is playing on the phrase "coffin to death" because it sounds like "coughin' to death".

het_102.pun_sense: the bags of letters and packages that are transported by the postal service; any particular collection of letters or packages that is delivered
het_102.alter_sense: for or pertaining to or composed of men or boys
het_102.human_text: The postmen get together for mail bonding .
het_102.human_explanation: "Mail bonding" sounds like "male bonding" which is when men get together to do fine things to increase emotional closeness and build a strong friendship. In the joke, mail was used to replace "male" because the people discussed are postmen. Postmen delivery mail. Mail refers to letters or packages carried in the postal system. This joke is playing on the word "mail".

het_1018.pun_sense: short-tailed wildcats with usually tufted ears; valued for their fur
het_1018.alter_sense: a golf course that is built on sandy ground near a shore
het_1018.human_text: As anyone who has ever lived in the area can tell you , life is different in Montana . Since golf courses are often placed in areas ideal for hunting , most golfers carry a hunting rifle in their golf bag and when the opportunity presents itself combine their two favorite pastimes . Recently one such sportsman got lost and had to stop for directions asking , ' ' Which way to the lynx . ' '
het_1018.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'lynx' which is a type of medium sized wild cat but it's also being used because it sounds exactly similar to 'links' which is a type of golf course

het_1016.alter_sense: sell or offer for sale from place to place
het_1016.human_text: The bicycle salesman had broken his ankle and was , alas , unable to pedal his wares .
het_1016.human_explanation: This is a pun on the word "pedal". They changed the word "peddle", which means to sell goods, with the similar-sounding word "pedal". A pedal is the part of a bicycle that you push with your feet and the man in the joke is a bicycle salesman.

het_1014.pun_sense: someone who takes the place of another (as when things get dangerous or difficult)
het_1014.alter_sense: move backwards from a certain position
het_1014.human_text: He only knew how to drive a fork lift in reverse . He was the backup man .
het_1014.human_explanation: This is a pun on the phrase 'backup man' which is usually meant to mean a peson who you have on reserve in case you need them, but it's also being used because when you drive in reverse you're backing up

het_1012.pun_sense: an upward slope or grade (as in a road); a movement upward; the act of changing location in an upward direction
het_1012.alter_sense: agreement with a statement or proposal to do something
het_1012.human_text: When I asked him whether we ought to climb the steep hill , he started up the incline and , in ascent , said , ' ' Yes . ' '
het_1012.human_explanation: This is a play on words. The word "assent" means an expression of approval or aggreement but "ascent" means a climb to the summit of a hill or incline.

het_101.alter_sense: the brightest star in the sky; in Canis Major
het_101.human_text: ' ' Boy , that ' s a bright star , ' ' said Tom seriously .
het_101.human_explanation: This is a play on words. The word "seriously" means with earnest intent but "sirius" is the brightest star in the night sky.

het_1007.pun_sense: something added to food primarily for the savor it imparts; the act of adding a seasoning to food
het_1007.alter_sense: a recurrent time marked by major holidays
het_1007.human_text: The salt said ' hi ' to the pepper . It was seasonings greetings .

het_1006.pun_sense: in a relative manner; by comparison to something else
het_1006.alter_sense: (physics) the theory that space and time are relative concepts rather than absolute concepts
het_1006.human_text: I heard Einstein got along well with his parents . . . relatively speaking .
het_1006.human_explanation: This is a pun on 'relatively' which is initially referring to Einsteins relation to his parents as they are related, but its also being used since Einstein came up with the theory on relativity

het_1002.pun_sense: in a weak or feeble manner or to a minor degree
het_1002.human_text: ' ' I visit my parents every Sunday , ' ' said Tom weakly .
het_1002.human_explanation: Weekly is a homophone of weakly. Weakly is a word that describes something that lacks strength or force. Weekly means occurring once a week. Tom visits his parents every Sunday, meaning Tom visits his parents weekly. The joke is centered on the word "weakly" since it sounds like "weekly" and that is how often Tom visits his parents.

het_100.pun_sense: large gregarious predatory feline of Africa and India having a tawny coat with a shaggy mane in the male
het_100.human_text: I phoned the zoo but the lion was busy .
het_100.human_explanation: This is a pun on the phrase 'the line was busy' which means that the telephone line was currently engaged in another call. However, 'lion' is used in it's place because it sounds similar and lions are an animal found in zoos

het_1.alter_sense: a projecting ridge on a mountain or submerged under water
het_1.human_text: ' ' I ' m halfway up a mountain , ' ' Tom alleged .
het_1.human_explanation: "Alleged" means to have said, without proof, that something has taken place. "Alleged" sounds close to "a ledge". A ledge is a horizontal surface project from a wall or cliff. Ledges are often seen on rock walls when rock climbing. Tom alleged that he is halfway up a mountain. The joke is centered around the word "alleged" and how it sounds like "a ledge" which is often seen when climbing a mountain.
